page.title: 03SHIREBROOK COLLIERY
page.content: With the colliery so dominating the community we felt it should come first in our pages of writing. 1984/85 was an exceptionally difficult year for the people of Shirebrook , due to the National Miners' strike. Not only did it affect the peace and harmony between miners and their families , but also the livelihood of many local tradespeople. Four miners' children visited the colliery and interviewed the manager. Here are their questions and answers. Q. How many people are employed at the pit ? A. 2,063 . Q. How many people work underground? A. 1,765.
